nodes.dialogue: Halt! Who dares approach the great Baron Carrotine?
nodes.response1: It is I, Leenk of the Homestead!
nodes.response2: Uh, hello. I didn't know it was wrong to just approach...
nodes.response3: Why are you so rude?

nodes.dialogue: Leenk of the Homestead? I've never herb of you.
nodes.response1: I live in the house just up the road with my parents, Momme de Terre and Pai Alho.
nodes.response2: That's okay, I've never herb of you, either.
nodes.response3: *stare blankly*

nodes.dialogue: Oh, you're Pai and Momme's little scallion? A pleasure to meet you!
nodes.response1: Technically a leek, but yes! Nice to meet you too. Would you like to come over for dinner?
nodes.response2: The pleasure is mine. Would you care to join us for some soup?
nodes.response3: I'm a leek...

nodes.dialogue: That sounds like a fine endive-r! Let us head back immediately!
nodes.response1: Yay!
nodes.response2: Good idea, I'm parched!

nodes.dialogue: A salad suggestion. Would you lead the way?
nodes.response1: I'd be delighted!
nodes.response2: Maybe you should take the lead.

nodes.dialogue: My apologies. Perhaps, as a show of good faith, I might join you for some supper this eve?
nodes.response1: Did you just invite yourself over for dinner? ... Okay, why not? Let's go!
nodes.response2: This is unbowlievable... Sure, I guess?

nodes.dialogue: YOU'VE never herb of ME?! Preposterous!
nodes.response1: Actually, my name is Leenk...
nodes.response2: Yikes, I'm sorry. I didn't mean to offend.
nodes.response3: Good thing I don't have ears... because I'm an anthropomorphic leek...

nodes.dialogue: That name seems familiar. Say, why don't we grab some supper? I can't think cleraly on an empty stomach.
nodes.response1: Sounds like a good idea, I know just the place.
nodes.response2: On second thought...

nodes.dialogue: I am not offended, just bewiltered! I am Baron Carrotine, proprietor of this homestead!
nodes.response1: I guess I've finally met the landlord.
nodes.response2: Oh, now that you mention it, I might have heard of you from Momme and Pai...

nodes.dialogue: Indeed? Well, might I accompany you back home? I do have business with your parents.
nodes.response1: Sure, that doesn't sound ominous at all!
nodes.response2: I don't see why not.
nodes.response3: Yeaaaah, maybe not...

nodes.dialogue: Indeed? Well, might I accompany you back home? I do have business with your parents.
nodes.response1: Sure, that doesn't sound ominous at all!
nodes.response2: I don't see why not.
nodes.response3: Yeaaaah, maybe not...

nodes.dialogue: Ah, well. No harm done. Carry on, little one!
nodes.response1: Seed you later!
nodes.response2: 'Little one'? How corny...

nodes.dialogue: I am Baron Carrotine, proprietor of this Homestead! How could you have never herb of me?
nodes.response1: I don't get out much.
nodes.response2: My parents probably know you.
nodes.response3: I seed...

nodes.dialogue: What an oddish excuse. Where do you live on the Homestead?
nodes.response1: My home is up the path. Did you want to go together?
nodes.response2: Down the road a bit. My parents are making soup tonight.
nodes.response3: 'Oddish'? I think you're in the wrong game...

nodes.dialogue: I would be delighted to accompany you back home.
nodes.response1: Excellent. Watch your step, the Deluge left a lot of mud.
nodes.response2: Just try to keep up, your Carrotiness.

nodes.dialogue: Soup? I ADORE soup! May I accompany you?
nodes.response1: Did... you just invite yourself over for dinner? Ah well, I guess. Let's go!
nodes.response2: Sure, I don't see why not.

nodes.dialogue: Well, this is awkward.
nodes.response1: Yup.
nodes.response2: Yeah...

nodes.dialogue: OH! You must be the little sprig that belongs to Momme and Pai!
nodes.response1: That would be me. It was nice meeting you, sir!
nodes.response2: Yep. Now, I must be off, I have heroic deeds to perform...
nodes.response3: Mhm, yeah, great, what did you say? Nevermind, bye!

nodes.dialogue: Yes... well...
nodes.response1: Have a nice day!
nodes.response2: Nice meeting you!
nodes.response3: Seed you around!

nodes.dialogue: Yes, well, how could you? You seem like a country pumpkin.
nodes.response1: Actually, I'm a leek.
nodes.response2: I'm a heroic adventurer!
nodes.response3: And YOU seem like a prickly pear!

nodes.dialogue: A leek? I know a leek. Momme and Pai have a leek!
nodes.response1: Yeah, those are my parents. We live just down the road.
nodes.response2: I know Momme and Pai, they're my parents.
nodes.response3: Who are they?

nodes.dialogue: Splendid! I'd like to see them, may we travel together?
nodes.response1: Sure, why not? It's getting late, anyway.
nodes.response2: That works for me, I need to head home.
nodes.response3: I don't think that's a good idea.

nodes.dialogue: Aren't you lucky, then? May we go to see them?
nodes.response1: That's fine, I'm getting hungry anyway. I hope there's soup...
nodes.response2: I don't see why not. Shall we?
nodes.response3: I don't think that's a good idea.

nodes.dialogue: Two very nice Kili from down the way. You should really go meet them one day.
nodes.response1: If I find myself over there, sure.
nodes.response2: I don't know, they sound a little corny...
nodes.response3: *shrug*

nodes.dialogue: A heroic adventurer, you say?
nodes.response1: Indeed! And I've worked up quite an appetite, so I'm heading home now!
nodes.response2: Yeah, it's a full time job!
nodes.response3: That's me! Daring, brave, and ready for anything!

nodes.dialogue: I, too, have worked up an appetite. Do you mind if I accompany you?
nodes.response1: Not at all, let's go!
nodes.response2: Yeah, I don't think my parents will mind at all!
nodes.response3: I guess. But I'm not going to slow down!

nodes.dialogue: Not many youngsters have full time jobs. You are quite unique!
nodes.response1: That's what my parents tell me!
nodes.response2: Thank you kindly, sir!
nodes.response3: Don't I know it!

nodes.dialogue: Aren't you a little too short to be an adventurer?
nodes.response1: Hey! I'm still growing!
nodes.response2: Maybe, but I try my best, and that's what matters!
nodes.response3: I didn't get a lot of sun when I was a sprout.

nodes.dialogue: I'm a carrot, not a pear! My, aren't you rude?!
nodes.response1: You called me a pumpkin when I am CLEARLY a leek.
nodes.response2: I'm just feeling a little wilted right now.

nodes.dialogue: You're right, I apologize for my demeanor.
nodes.response1: That's alright, why don't we go back to my house and get some soup?
nodes.response2: I'm feeling a little wilted myself.

nodes.dialogue: That sounds like a grand idea! Lead the way!
nodes.response1: Onwards!
nodes.response2: Why don't you lead us?

nodes.dialogue: Shall we go somewhere to rest our roots?
nodes.response1: I know just the place!
nodes.response2: Sure, follow me!

nodes.dialogue: That's fair. Say, why don't we go somewhere to rest?
nodes.response1: That's a good idea, why don't you follow me?
nodes.response2: I suppose. Come with me.

nodes.dialogue: I've bean in the sun for too much thyme.
nodes.response1: That doesn't mean you need to be rude.
nodes.response2: That's no excuse!

nodes.dialogue: You're right. I'm sorry. I need to take root somewhere...
nodes.response1: Well, I have somewhere we can go.
nodes.response2: Do you like soup?

nodes.dialogue: I'd appeaciate the chance to rest!
nodes.response1: Come with me!
nodes.response2: So would I, I've bean out all day. Let's go!

nodes.dialogue: I ADORE soup!
nodes.response1: Come with me, then! We can get the best soup!
nodes.response2: Then let's go get some soup!

nodes.dialogue: You're right. I'm sorry. Can we start over?
nodes.response1: I suppose. I'm a hero, after all.
nodes.response2: Sure, I guess.
nodes.response3: My feelers are kind of hurt...

nodes.dialogue: Well, hero, where to?
nodes.response1: I've got just the place! Let's go!
nodes.response2: To my house! There's soup!

nodes.dialogue: I would like to accompany you on your return journey.
nodes.response1: Bean my guest! Follow me!
nodes.response2: Then lettuce head out!

nodes.dialogue: I understand. I apologize. I hope you have a nice day, besides...
nodes.response1: Peas out!
nodes.response2: Goodbye.
